name: Bridge Constructor
description: Become an appraised bridge engineer and architect in Bridge Constructor. Create and design your own constructions and watch the cars and trucks pass over them - or see them fall and crash while your inferior creations collapse due to weight and the laws of physics!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8 Processor: 1,8 GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX9 compatible with Shader Model 2.0

reviews.review_text: This game is awesome. It’s a simple premise: You build bridges. In reality it is a puzzle game with many solutions. Each level has a set of materials and a budget to work within, but it is up to you how you want to end up bridging the gap. That’s not to say most of your “solutions” won’t fail miserably. You are also constrained by physics and the properties of the given materials. In addition, it is not enough that your structure simply doesn’t collapse under its own weight; it has to be able to support traffic of different loads. I’ve lost count of the number of times that some trucks barely made it to the other side as my bridge built with spit and good intentions fell into a shattered ruin in their wake. This makes even the failures entertaining as you look what when wrong and iteratively adjust your design until it works. I definitely recommend it to the engineering-minded as it will occasionally force you to think outside the box to solve the problem at hand.

Bridge Constructor is a brilliant game that puts you in the position of a builder constructing bridges across the 5 islands within the game. Each level tests your skills at being able to solve how to build a bridge in a means to get vehicles across. Anybody who knows of a program called West Point Bridge Designer will find this game to be quite similar, but the achievements and challenges presented will hook you right in. While you are able to build a sensible, well-thought bridge that will do the job perfectly, it's extremely fun to be able to build crazy bridges with massive jumps that still transport vehicles. The physics engine is so fun to play around with through each bridge design - launching cars off your 'ramps' in the hopes of reaching the end - and the ability to do what you will when constructing bridges to finish each level is amazing.  A game that I strongly recommend to anybody interested in purchasing this game.

I've played a few bridge construction versions over the years. Compared to the previous one I played, this one added some features and took some others away. New to me were concrete, slope mania, and tanker trucks. Gone were two-way traffic, moving bridges, and the ability to adjust the 3rd dimension (bridge width). Overall this version results in a polishes experience that gets it just right. Sometimes it's hard to build a nice bridge, sometimes you can get away with crazy cheap designs. I enjoy it quite a bit.  Slope Mania was fun as well, containing a mix of both hard and trivial challenges. It allows for some bridges that totally collapse while the tanker truck races downward and still makes it across.

The first two challenges (car/truck) are super easy. The challenge isn't really there until you beat everything and unlock the super tanker truck, and you have to relearn everything you thought you knew about building bridges. Having fun with it.

Because i had more fun squeezing the Charmin, and i will never design or construct bridges.  I mean i had so many things to say about this, but then my cat started to yak and i decided to watch him projectile vomit as my wife chased him around the house.
